title: Dominant Transport Service Sector
description: In 2023, Mozambique's transport services accounted for 76.91% of its service exports, the highest percentage globally, highlighting the sector's significance to the country's economy.

title: High External Debt Burden
description: Mozambique's external debt stocks reached 349.68% of its GNI in 2023, marking the highest ratio worldwide and indicating a significant financial challenge.

title: Significant Government Employee Compensation
description: In 2022, 62.02% of Mozambique's government expenses were allocated to employee compensation, the highest globally, reflecting a substantial public sector wage bill.

title: Prolonged Export Customs Clearance
description: In 2018, the average time to clear exports through customs in Mozambique was 39.3 days, the longest duration worldwide, indicating inefficiencies in trade facilitation.

title: High Primary Education Intake for Males
description: Mozambique had a gross intake ratio of 173.88% for males entering the first grade of primary education in 2018, the highest globally, suggesting over-age or repeat enrollments.

title: Low Income for Bottom 40% of Population
description: In 2019, the bottom 40% of Mozambique's population had a mean consumption of $0.74 per day, the lowest globally, highlighting severe income inequality and poverty.

title: Low Overall Income Levels
description: The total population's mean consumption in Mozambique was $2.30 per day in 2019, the lowest globally, underscoring widespread poverty.

title: Minimal Elderly Male Population
description: In 2023, only 1.00% of Mozambique's male population was aged 60-64, the lowest percentage worldwide, reflecting demographic challenges.

title: Diverse Sources for Voice and Accountability
description: Mozambique had 14 sources for voice and accountability in 2023, the highest globally, indicating a diverse range of perspectives in governance.
